lead_paragraph: A flag from the Exodus, a ship carrying 4,500 Jewish refugees that was turned away from Palestine by the British in 1947, has been donated to the Holocaust Memorial Museum in Washington.

headline.print_headline: Exodus Flag Finds Safe Haven: Holocaust Museum
headline.main: Exodus Refugee Ship Flag Finds Safe Haven at Holocaust Museum

snippet: A flag from the Exodus, a ship carrying 4,500 Jewish refugees that was turned away from Palestine by the British in 1947, has been donated to the Holocaust Memorial Museum in Washington.
abstract: Brothers Bill and Tom Silverstein donate flag from ship Exodus, historic vessel that carried 4,500 Holocaust survivors to Palestine in 1947, to Holocaust Memorial Museum in Washington; symbol of ill-fated voyage, in which all aboard were turned away from sanctuary by British is viewed as particularly poignant today as Middle East and Africa refugee crisis grows.
